department_goals.why: PMF requires proving Kartel works for different industries. Client count and vertical diversity demonstrate market demand; revenue proves the business model works. We need to close $7M in 2026 while covering 5 key verticals with referenceable clients. Every new client validates the 70% Problem thesis and creates proof points for the next deal. Spec engagements (unpaid) still deliver value—they allow other teams to build use cases and discover capacity limits.
department_goals.goal: Sign 18+ enterprise spec engagements across 5 verticals, convert 75%+ to paying clients, and close $7M in revenue by end of 2026.

department_goals.why: Retention and expansion are cheaper than acquisition. NPS proves value to prospects and investors. Case studies are sales ammunition. If clients aren't successful and referenceable, PMF isn't proven—it's just revenue. Client success starts in the 2-month spec period and compounds through the full engagement.
department_goals.goal: Achieve 50+ NPS, publish 5 case studies, and retain 90%+ of clients past the spec period into full agreements.

department_goals.why: Sales can't scale on hero effort with a 2-person team. To hit 18+ clients and $7M, we need to build the team—SVP of Sales to lead, Account Managers to own client relationships (each AM can handle 2x the clients a Producer can). Clean handoffs protect margin and client trust. Accurate pipeline reporting enables Production capacity planning and Executive decision-making.
department_goals.goal: Build a sales team capable of scaling to 18+ clients, establish handoff discipline with Production, and deliver reliable pipeline forecasting to Executive team.

department_goals.why: Production is the connective tissue between Sales promises, Generative execution, and client outcomes. Every client engagement lives or dies on four handoffs: (1) Sales closes, Production scopes in the platform; (2) Production requests pod resources from Generative; (3) Generative delivers back to Production for client; (4) Production delivers Closing Report to Sales for NPS, re-engagement, and case study creation. These handoffs must be tracked in the Production Platform—not Slack, not email, not tribal knowledge. We cannot scale to 20 clients without handoff discipline. We cannot win without them.
department_goals.goal: Establish and enforce a platform-tracked handoff system that scales Production from 6 to 20 active client engagements with measurable compliance across all four handoffs.

department_goals.why: Kartel's business model depends on clients continuously requesting jobs through the platform. We charge monthly fees ($25-50K minimum) because clients get ongoing value from their workflows. Production must deliver against client workflow agreements (e.g., 3-day turnaround) to prove the model works. High request volume + on-time delivery = retention + expansion. Enterprise buyers expect predictability; acquirers and investors care about margins.
department_goals.goal: Achieve 50% production margin, 90%+ on-time delivery against workflow SLAs, and growing client platform engagement.

department_goals.why: Each client pod requires a Producer. Pod 1 (Generative core team) is fully staffed as a fixed cost. Additional Producers, AI Generalists, and Preditors are funded by new revenue ($25-50K/month per enterprise client). Production must scale capacity in lockstep with client growth—not ahead, not behind. The target client-to-producer ratio is 4:1, but the actual sustainable ratio is unknown and must be discovered.
department_goals.goal: Scale Production capacity to support 20 clients by adding Producers proportional to revenue, while discovering and optimizing the sustainable client-to-producer ratio.

outcomes.description: Producer job description & hiring criteria documented

department_goals.why: Kartel scales by deploying complete pods to enterprise clients—not individual hires. Each pod needs a Workflow Engineer, AI Generalist, Preditor, and Data/LoRA specialist working in sync. The core capability is building custom workflows on custom-trained data, then outputting content at scale while feeding approved outputs back into training data to continuously improve accuracy. If roles aren't clearly defined and this cycle isn't documented, we can't replicate the team—and every new client engagement becomes a scramble instead of a deployment. Critically, we must also discover how many concurrent clients one Generative pod can handle before we need to scale to Pod 2.
department_goals.goal: Every Generative team role is documented with a written playbook that is reviewed and approved as onboarding-ready, with pod capacity load-tested through real or pro-bono projects by end of Q1, and maximum concurrent client capacity per pod discovered and documented by EOY.

outcomes.description: Playbooks reviewed & approved as onboarding ready
Pod capacity load-tested (full cycle: workflow → LoRA → output → feedback)
Max concurrent clients per Gen pod (discovered)

department_goals.why: The AI landscape evolves faster than any other space. What's cutting-edge today is outdated in months. The Generative team must stay ahead of the curve—systematically evaluating new tools, models, and techniques—so every deliverable uses the best available technology. Our competitive advantage is solving the 70% Problem through custom workflows and custom-trained models. Maintaining accuracy requires robust QC processes that measure bulk run success rates and continuous model optimization through the feedback loop.
department_goals.goal: Maintain technical leadership through systematic R&D, robust QC processes measuring bulk output success rates, and LoRA evaluation standards that support the 70% → 100% accuracy promise.

outcomes.description: QC process documented and in use (bulk run success + visual standards)
LoRA Eval tool deployed and integrated
Bulk run success rate (≥1 client-worthy output per batch)

department_goals.why: Kartel can't scale by adding headcount for every new client. The Generative Platform is how we multiply capacity. The Internal Enterprise Platform gives Generative and Production teams custom tools that accelerate their workflow. The Community Ecosystem Platform powers Daniel's Talent Engine—enabling generation credits, challenges, and the certification pipeline that attracts and retains talent. Kartel Labs is where the team builds vibe-coded internal tools that optimize their own jobs and prepare them to onboard Pod 2, compounding efficiency over time.
department_goals.goal: Expand the Generative Platform across three pillars—Internal Enterprise tools, Community Ecosystem infrastructure (with Niels), and Kartel Labs internal tool development—with monthly Demo Days and adoption across Generative, Production, and Community teams.

outcomes.description: Internal Enterprise Platform: Key use cases (LoRA, captioning, curation, chat)
Community Ecosystem Platform: Core features live
Kartel Labs: Team-built tools (optimize role + Pod 2 onboarding)

department_goals.why: Kartel scales by deploying complete pods to enterprise clients—not by hiring full-time headcount for every new engagement. Creative engineering talent barely exists in the market; the few people with these skills are expensive and hard to recruit. A gamified community with clear progression paths lets us identify, train, and certify top generative talent at scale. Daniel provides qualified talent; Fill onboards and deploys them. This is cheaper than recruiting, faster than hiring, and creates a talent moat competitors can't replicate.
department_goals.goal: Build a 1,000+ member Discord community with a gamified 5-tier pipeline that certifies and delivers 20 qualified generative artists ready for pod deployment by EOY.

outcomes.description: Qualified talent ready for pod deployment (Tier 5)

department_goals.why: The Talent Engine only works if the community is active, engaged, and progressing. A Discord with 1,000 members means nothing if they're not participating. Tracking system health—engagement rates, tier progression velocity, and platform usage—ensures we're building a sustainable pipeline, not a vanity metric.
department_goals.goal: Operate a high-performing community system with strong weekly engagement, efficient tier progression, and high platform utilization.

department_goals.why: Current operations rely on manual coordination across client engagements. To support 10+ concurrent clients without linear headcount growth, Kartel needs a unified platform that manages the full client lifecycle—from job requests and asset ingestion, through LoRA training outputs and generated media, to client feedback and final deliverables. The Enterprise Platform gives enterprise clients a professional interface for collaboration and approval workflows, while giving internal teams (Production and Generative) the tools to manage work efficiently. Platform's role is integration: connecting Fill's Generative Platform into the larger ecosystem with proper data organization, user access, and workflow connections.
department_goals.goal: Deploy the Enterprise Platform (Client Portal + Production Management) to support 10+ concurrent client engagements, with full integration to Fill's Generative Platform.

outcomes.description: Production Management in use (jobs, milestones, resources, handoffs)
Client Portal live (job requests, asset management, feedback, deliverables)
Generative Platform integration (LoRA outputs, media assets accessible)

department_goals.why: Enterprise clients require demonstrated security maturity before approving vendors. The specific compliance requirements vary by client—some may require SOC2, others may have different standards. What's non-negotiable is that client data must be protected, and all data, training, and workflows must be built with enterprise-grade protections. Platform owns the technical controls (access management, logging, encryption, infrastructure hardening) that form the foundation of security readiness.
department_goals.goal: Implement technical controls that protect client data and meet enterprise security requirements, achieving compliance certifications (e.g., SOC2) as required by whale client deals.

outcomes.description: Security controls implemented (access mgmt, logging, encryption, infrastructure)
Client data isolation verified (air-gapped where required)
Compliance certification (SOC2 or equivalent, if required by clients)

department_goals.why: Kartel's platform ecosystem spans multiple systems—Enterprise Platform, Generative Platform, Community systems, and Kartel Labs. Today, each system manages users independently with fragmented authentication. This creates duplicated effort, inconsistent access control, and friction for both internal users and clients. Most critically, the Talent Engine depends on a seamless user journey: community members need to flow from Discord into the open parts of the Generative Platform, then into Production Platform when they qualify for pod work. Unified identity makes this journey possible.
department_goals.goal: Deploy unified authentication and centralized user management across all Kartel platforms, enabling the Community → Generative → Production user journey with single sign-on for all users (internal, client, and community).

outcomes.description: Platforms integrated with SSO (Enterprise, Generative, Community, Labs)
Full user journey functional (Community → Generative → Production)
